titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Panhellenic Council (Washington State University) Records 1977-1981
titlestmt.author: James Feller

publicationstmt.publisher: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-05-31.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS 2nd Edition ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

did.abstract: This collection consists of records related to the Panhellenic Council at Washington State University, as well as a small amount of papers related to the Western Regional Panhellenic Council.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of the Washington State University (WSU) Panhellenic Council relating to Rush procedures, as well as meeting minutes for the council and the Fraternity Welfare Advisory Committee. The collection also contains a series of "Programming Newsletters" published by the WSU Department of Residence Living, and a small assortment of notes from the Western Regional Panhellenic Council Vice President from 1979-1980.

bioghist.p: The Panhellenic Council was an organization designed to bring the WSU campus sororities together to foster fair conduct for all the members of the sororities. This campus level organization was also under the Western Regional Panhellenic Council, which, in 1984, merged with the Western Regional Interfraternity Conference to create the Western Regional Greek Conference. As of 2018, it continues to operate as the Association of Fraternal Leadership and Values.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

processinfo.p: James Feller processed this collection in 2018.

acqinfo.p: This collection was originally donated to the Washington State Libraries by Kim Schulteis in 1984 (MS.1984.36). Additional materials were added in 1985 by Stephanie Smith (MS.1985.03).
